job.title: Regulatory Operations Associate II
job.description: stronguDescriptionbrbrustrongemPosition at Regulatory ProfessionalsbrbremstrongBring your PassionbrbrstrongRegulatory Professionals a division of Premier Research is a consultancy firm specializing in drug biologics and device regulatory affairs Our purpose as a company is to support our clients by furthering the development of human therapeutics that will benefit the health and wellbeing of patients around the world With a presence in the US EU Canada and Japan we are growing and looking for talented people to grow our business advance the goals of our clients and contribute to our unique culture Our focus is to provide strategic and tactical support in all aspects of regulatory affairs including preclinical CMC and clinical development for drugs biologics devices and combination productsbrbrstrongWe are seeking a talented Regulatory Operations Associate II to join our growing team at RPI This position is an office based position located in Newark CAbrbrstrongThe strongRegulatory Operations Associate IIstrong ROA II is responsible for preparing and reviewing documents and compilingQC auditing submissions for regulatory applications This role ensures that all electronic regulatory submissions performed on behalf of Regulatory Professionals and Corporate clientele are in compliance with FDAEMA regulations The ROA II exercises judgment within defined procedures and practices to determine appropriate actions and resolve a variety of issuesbrbrstronguWhat You Will Be DoingbrustrongulliCreate and format basic to advanced documents utilizing internal processes and tools to perform the activities pertaining to electronic publishing to meet required standards and technical requirements within specified timelinesliliCoordinate and electronically publish components of basic to semicomplex Regulatory Agency submissions including INDs and amendments annual reports safety reports etcliliPerform the QC for all applications amendments and supplements prior to submitting to AgencyliliPerform quality checks of others workliliParticipate in the interpretation and implementation of new health agency guidelines and rules relevant to regulatory submissionsliliParticipate in department projects that improve the department systems and processesliliAssist in the writing and reviewing of Regulatory Operations work practicesliliAssist in collaboration with regulatory operations team and sponsors with regulatory submission timelines in accordance with project plansbrliulstronguYoull Need This To Be ConsideredbrustrongulliBachelors degree or international equivalent from an accredited institution in ScienceTechnology or an equivalent combination of education and experienceliliBABS degree and 2  5 years direct experience or 4 years of Regulatory Operations experience within the pharmaceutical or biotech industryliliIntermediate skills in the use of Microsoft Office Word Adobe Professional and ToolboxliliExperience in eCTD publishing tools such as docuBridge Global Submit andor eCTDXpress for submissionsliliCurrent knowledge of electronic document and submission requirements applicable to
